title: Teaching & Mentoring
text: I am committed to training the next generation of ecologists, with a focus on quantitative methods and reproducible science.

title: Teaching & Mentoring
text:
Courses Taught

Graduate Level

Species distribution modeling (60h)

Role: Teaching assistant (2021-2023) / Professor (2025)
Programs: PPGE-UFRJ & PPGBIO-UNIRIO

Open science practices (30h)

Role: Professor (2025)
Program: PPGE-UFRJ

Geospatial analysis applied to animal biology (45h)

Role: Teaching assistant (2020)
Program: PPGBA-UFRRJ




Undergraduate Level

Behavioral ecology (45h)

Role: Teaching assistant (2014)
Institution: FAMATH

Biology of marine mammals (60h)

Role: Teaching assistant (2013-2014)
Institution: FAMATH

title: Teaching & Mentoring
text:

title: Outreach
text: I believe in making science accessible beyond academia. I frequently contribute to media outlets and educational projects to share our findings on cetacean conservation.

title: Outreach
text:
Science Communication
I actively produce content to bridge the gap between scientific research and the general public.

The Conversation
I am a recurring author at The Conversation, an independent source of news and views from the academic and research community.






Noteüë§ Visit my profile



Check out my latest articles.




Other articles

title: Outreach
text:
Media & Press
I actively engage with the press to discuss marine biodiversity and conservation challenges. My contributions include interviews for TV, printed newspapers, and online news portals.

üì∫ TV & Video Interviews: You can watch a curated collection of my media appearances on my YouTube playlist.
üì∞ Print & Online News: I have provided expert commentary for various national and international outlets.

title: About
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Guilherme Maricato
text:
I am an ecologist with over 10 years of experience in marine mammal conservation. My research focuses on spatial ecology and environmental changes, aiming to mitigate conflicts between biodiversity and human activities.
Currently, I am a postdoctoral research fellow at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (UFRJ) and a courtesy postdoctoral associate at Florida International University (FIU).
I also collaborate with the Marine Ecology and Conservation Lab (ECoMAR), the Islands of Rio Project, and the Brazilian Humpback Whale Institute.



Spatial modeling
Human-wildlife interactions
Conservation policy
Open science

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Last updated: January 2026.
This is a personal academic website. I respect your privacy and do not collect personal data from visitors for commercial purposes.

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Data Collection
This website is static and hosted on GitHub Pages. I do not personally collect, store, or sell any data from visitors.
However, as a hosting provider, GitHub may collect typical server log information (such as your IP address and browser type) for security and reliability purposes. You can read GitHub‚Äôs Global Privacy Statement here.

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Cookies
This website does not use tracking cookies or third-party advertising cookies.

title: Privacy Policy
text:
Contact
If you have any questions about this website, you can contact me at guilherme.maricato@biologia.ufrj.br.

title: Research
text: My research combines quantitative ecology with conservation biology to answer questions across three main themes:

title: Research
text:
Species Distribution Modeling
I apply and develop spatial analysis frameworks to predict species occurrence and habitat suitability. My work investigates how environmental and anthropogenic variables drive the distribution of cetaceans, from estuarine dolphins to oceanic whales.

Key focus: Understanding the functional diversity of marine mammals in changing environments.

title: Research
text:
Human Impacts & Marine Spatial Planning
A major part of my research assesses the overlap between marine biodiversity and anthropogenic stressors. I evaluate exposure to threats to identify conflict zones and propose management actions.

Key focus: Investigating marine protected areas (MPAs) effectiveness for marine mammals in climate change scenarios.

title: Research
text:
Applied Science & Cross-Sectoral Experience
My professional trajectory is built on the intersection of academic research, non-governmental organizations (NGOs), and environmental consulting. This hybrid background allows me to bridge the gap between theoretical ecology and practical conservation, translating complex scientific data into actionable management solutions.

Research laboratories: As a researcher in academic institutions, I focus on developing rigorous quantitative frameworks and answering fundamental ecological questions about marine species.
NGOs & environmental projects: Working with organizations, I gained extensive field experience in monitoring cetacean populations and understanding the on-the-ground challenges of marine conservation.
Environmental consulting: I apply my technical expertise in data collection and analysis to provide evidence-based assessments for environmental licensing and impact studies, ensuring that scientific products directly support decision-making processes.
